TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ArgumentToExpressionModelItemConverter extends System.Object implements class System.Windows.Data.IMultiValueConverter

Docs.summary: Defines the mapping between arguments and expression model items and provides the functionality to convert between these objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This converter can be used to bind data to an <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.View.ExpressionTextBox> or other WPF control. For more information, see [Using an ExpressionTextBox in a custom property editor](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=224791).
## Examples [!code-cs[XpsCreate#XpsCreateAddPkgContent](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/XpsCreate/XpsCreate.cs#xpscreateaddpkgcontent)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public object Convert (object[] values, Type targetType, object parameter, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object Convert(object[] values, class System.Type targetType, object parameter, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified argument to an expression model item.
Docs.returns: Returns a <xref:System.Object> that contains the expression model item.

MemberSignature.Value: public object[] ConvertBack (object value, Type[] targetTypes, object parameter, System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object[] ConvertBack(object value, class System.Type[] targetTypes, object parameter, class System.Globalization.CultureInfo culture) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified expression model item to an argument.
Docs.returns: Returns a <xref:System.Object> that contains the argument.
